meanings.definition: One who promulgates or makes known
meanings.sent1: The teacher was the promulgator of the new school rules.
meanings.sent2: The promulgator of the news article shared it with the entire class.
meanings.sent3: The promulgator of the secret party location accidentally revealed it to everyone.
meanings.sent4: The promulgator of positivity spread joy wherever they went.
meanings.sent5: The promulgator of the important message made sure everyone heard it loud and clear.

meanings.definition: The act of promulgating or making known
meanings.sent1: The promulgator of the announcement was the principal.
meanings.sent2: The promulgator of the decree ensured it reached all citizens.
meanings.sent3: The promulgator of the weather forecast predicted a sunny day.
meanings.sent4: The promulgator of the event details made sure no one missed out.
meanings.sent5: The promulgator of the new policy explained it thoroughly to the team.
